It plays perfectly fine in VLC, make sure you are using the latest version of it too.

 I'm on a shit PC atm, which has a 32mb gfx card to give you an idea of how old it is haha and it plays this in VLC with no problems..

 So I don't think the problem is this file if you're having difficulties playing it.

great quality for the size

Don't listen to all these complaints! Quality is PERFECT, everything plays fluently on quite old computer. You just need a proper player (I'm using VLC for mp4 files) and I guarantee, you'll have no problems. Great compression, so small size of the file, and still it looks much better than most of 175mb avi releases! Thanks Eztv!

i don't like MP4s, i frequently had problem playing them, yet haven't tried 'em since i got the latest version of VLC... running on a 5or6 y/o Toshiba laptop with WindowsVistaHomePremium.
Generally, I had a hard time when slowing down an MP4 vid or when rewinding/f.fowarding it while it plays. (i watch eng. progs. though i'm not eng. native).
I like MP4's, but only for short stuff like music videos..
I just checked out the video. The quality is as good as avi, except it's 3 times smaller in size. This saves up a lot of room on my HDD. I'm prolly gonna convert all 300 gigs of my TV shows to mp4.
By smaller size, I meant the file is only 64mb. And the resolution is even bigger than usual.
wow great quality for only 64MB amazing +1

thanks!

Perfect quality!! plays fluently. No freezing whatsoever. I use vlc to play all video files. Thanks eztv!! It was about time .avi format was bid goodbye.

Since no one else here has anything constructive to say... I'm sure it plays fine on VLC, but I like to share what I download with friends, who have computers of all variations, and most/all don't have VLC. This one's running like garbage on a fast (quad-core)computer, and the same on a mediocre (dual-core) laptop. "Get a faster computer" - Thats what I'm talking about. "Oh, okay. I'll go spend $800 on a new top-o-the-line system, just so I can save an extra 60 megs of space." Maybe this file format will pan out in the future, and if it works for you, thats awesome! But until then, if you're a "collector" like myself, well...an external hard drive is a lot cheaper than buying a new system to appease what I consider a "bugged" compression format.

Now I'm sure someone has something non-constructive to say to this, so let the flames begin.. (not that I'll be here to read them.)
thanks
Windows 7 64 bit , runs perfect on vlc player

Where are tonight's episodes? 

 They were all new and are uncharacteristically late getting uploaded, starting to worry they aren't coming! >:(


 @twijjit

 If your friends don't have VLC, it only takes a quick google search, and if these friends also don't have internet it's only a small file so you could easily give it to them with the other files you share..

 Nothing else is needed, not even extra codecs that those other progs your friends are using required.

 But no, that is too difficult and you'd rather be stubborn and fight any change. Suit yourself.

 How powerful or not a PC is really doesnt matter here either, as i've said i'm on a shit box that is 11 years old and everything plays fine when using VLC.

I guess they aren't getting uploaded to TPB this time..?

 They are all over at kickass torrents (kat.ph or just google the show and season/episode number), uploaded by the same trusted users.

 Don't forget Bob's Burgers S02 premiered too!

For some reason this is the only video file my Samsung tv won't play properly, I get audio drops every 5-20 second for maybe half a second at a time. So I end up missing out words. Very weird considering that the TV will play absolutely everything else I throw at it and I have owned it for just over a year and nothing else has failed to play absolutely flawlessly. This only happens with this torrent and American Dad also LOL.
